thread.title: Cool change ahead for south-east Queensland after record-breaking heatwave
thread.title_full: Cool change ahead for south-east Queensland after record-breaking heatwave

author: Kerrin Binnie And Elaine Ford
title: Cool change ahead for south-east Queensland after record-breaking heatwave
text:
47.2C Source: Bureau of Meteorology using Sunday's temperatures 
"We had about 70 localised problems, some of those were heat-related, and we had a couple of issues that weren't [in] any way related to the heat," he said. 
"We had a problem with an ... underground cable yesterday that was just one of those unfortunate coincidences." 
He said the bulk of the problems on Sunday were simply energy loads driven up by people using air-conditioners. 
"As I said on Friday, I didn't expect an overall peak demand — we didn't get one," Mr Price said. 
"What we did get was very, very high demand — unprecedented Sunday peak and it was driven entirely by domestic air-conditioning. 
"We saw that peak continue beyond 7:00pm, which is very unusual — it held on, no doubt with people wanting to stay cool with those temperatures still very high this morning. 
"About 6:00pm we usually see the load starting to drop off — last night it continued on into the night driven by those extremely high temperatures during the day."
